revised_title: Ecological and Morphological Study of Atyid Prawns in Dominica
tldr: This study examines six species of atyid prawns found in Dominica's streams, focusing on their ecology, habits, and the relationship between their gross morphology and ways of life. The research describes the unique features and feeding mechanisms of each species, highlighting the specialized chelipeds and mouthparts that help them collect and manipulate food particles. The atyid mandibles and fore-gut structures are also analyzed, providing insights into the evolution of these prawns and their adaptation to their environment.
